result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Larry A. Amundson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 74 days presentence credit if revoked.
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation.  Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample if not already recorded/submitted. Court does assess the DNA surcharge.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Larry A. Amundson in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR; Ct. heard plea of No Contest to OWI-5th.  The Court found plea was given FKVI, accepted plea, and found Def guilty of OWI-5th.  Court found factual basis in the Criminal Complaint/Information.  BAC was .169%.  The Court heard from State and Defense and sentenced the defendant as follows:  S/W, 3 years probation with conditions:  360 days in the DCJail with H/T privileges, Fine of $600 plus costs, plus driver improvement surcharge; AODA assessment and follow-through, absolute sobriety, no going on premises of bars, taverns, beer tents, etc., shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid Wisconsin driver's license, VIP w/in 120 days.  His operating privilege is revoked for 36 months, IIL for 36 months.  74 days of credit in the event of a revocation, but defendant is ordered to serve the above sentence as asked for above (approx. 9 months-270 days).  Defendant is not eligible for alcohol court.  Jail to commence forthwith.

Defendant Larry A. Amundson in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Robert G Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns;  bail con't.  Atty. Wineke requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:57) Defendant Larry A. Amundson in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (may appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests cash; Prelim requested within time limits. PH 4/10/14 at 1:30pm in Br. 2 & RH 4/9/14 at 8:15am in Br. 2; Court sets bond at $2,500.00 CASH BOND with conditions: #6, 6a; #10; #14
